Text:
Thx, i know this album for years. I think it was released in 1998 and since then it has
become a classic. Downtempo at its most elegant and cossy state. Im now going after their Dj Kicks session you posted here, although being a supporter of Kruder & Dorfmeister for years, never had the opportunity to listen to it really. I also strongly recommend their previous work: G-Stoned E.P., which are four of K&D own themes (K&D Sessions standard). I've got them in mp3 independently (long ago there was the Audiogalaxy golden age...), I can post them in TPB too if you ask so. Greetings.
great job j-dog! Been looking for this one for a while! thanx for sharing.
I didn't know about a bronze and a silver version. The set in the standard K&D Sessions is pretty tight arranged, so it has to do with bonus tracks or a book i presume.
This is a defect album. Track 21 (Strange Cargo / Million Town) is missing. Great album otherwise...
This is one CD I actually own!  But I'm going to download it anyway :)
bittorrent says it's wrong torrent... why?
If track 21 is missing, can someone plese upload it??  Please?   :->
Is anyone else having trouble with the files? I try and load them into itunes and it just doesnt work. Mind you I can still play them in winamp.
I think ive discovered the problem. The ID Tags are messed up. Can anyone confirm?

If you like K&D check out their labels K7 and G-Stone recordings.
I've heard that they two don't get along very good lately, so they both started remixing separately:

Richard Dorfmeister & Peter Huber: 
   Tosca:
      Opera: http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/3699841/Tosca_-_Opera
